description: This savory sweet potato pie balances savory spices with the sweetness from the sweet potatoes. The nutty pecans and the oat-pecan crust  make this pie even more delicious.
keywords: kosher,gluten-free,healthy, thanksgiving, holidays, side dish, dessert
name: Sweet Potato Pie Vegan and Gluten-Free
recipeIngredient: 2 large sweet potatoes, washed and scrubbed ( see note 1)
1/4 tsp Aleppo Pepper or Hot Red pepper flakes (optional)
1 store-bought frozen pie crust of your choice or make your own crust. See recipe below.
1/4 tsp ground black pepper (or to taste)
Use sweetened vanilla plant-based milk beverage instead of unsweetened
Add an additional 1/4 to 1/2 cup brown sugar to the filling when processing, depending on how sweet you want the filling to be. Remember, no raw eggs here, so you can taste it as you go!
Sauté a finely grated medium apple instead of the onion.
Add an additional tablespoon of brown sugar to the topping and skip the black pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or tin foil.

Place the sweet potatoes on the baking sheet, and carefully poke the sweet potatoes multiple times with a sharp knife. Bake for 45-60 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are soft all the way through. Insert a knife to check, the sweet potatoes should be soft with no hard spots.

While the sweet potatoes are roasting, heat the olive oil in a large skillet. Add the diced onion and cook at medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add maple syrup and balsamic vinegar and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes
Combine corn starch and warm plant-based milk in a small bowl and whisk until smooth. Set aside.
Mix all the topping ingredients together in a small bowl. Set aside.
Once the sweet potatoes are baked and cool enough to handle remove and discard the skin and place the sweet potatoes in a large bowl. Mash with a fork.
Once the sweet potatoes are done cooking reduce the oven temperature to 350°F.
Add cooked onions, spices, and corn starch mixture to the mashed sweet potatoes and mix until combined.
Pour spiced mashed sweet potatoes into the pie crust and top with the pecan mixture.
Place the pie crust on a baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes.
Let the pie cool before enjoying it.
